content.title: Akanksha Scheme
content.details: According to the plan of the Government of Madhya Pradesh, Tribal Affairs Department, the target is to provide coaching to the scheduled tribe students of the state for the preparation of national entrance examination (JEE, NEET / AIIMS, CLET) from reputed coaching institutes in division headquarters Bhopal, Indore, Jabalpur and Gwalior while studying in class 11th and 12th.
benefits: Coaching to the scheduled tribe students of the state for the preparation of national entrance examination (JEE, NEET / AIIMS, CLET) from reputed coaching institutes in division headquarters Bhopal, Indore, Jabalpur and Gwalior while studying in class 11th and 12th.
100 students will be coached for engineering, 50 for medical and 50 for class at each coaching center.
Along with coaching, accommodation facility and teaching facility in class 11th and 12th.
eligibility: The applicant will have to register his profile in the website www.tribal.mp.gov.in/MPTAAS of the Sarvapatham Department.
The applicant should be a native of Madhya Pradesh and a member of scheduled tribe.
The annual income of the applicant's parents/ guardians/ self from all sources is Rs. Not more than 6.00 lakh.
The student should be eligible to take admission in class 10th by passing class 11th.
The student will be selected for coaching on the basis of merit obtained through the entrance examination conducted by the coaching institute.
It is mandatory to link bank account with Aadhaar number.
The applicant must have a digital caste certificate.
The result of the student's class 10th examination should be more than 60 percent or 60 percent.

faqs.question: Who Can Apply For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The Akanksha Scheme is for the scheduled tribe students of 11th and 12th applying for entrance exam.

faqs.question: Are There Any Discounts Available On The Fees Charged By The M-Pendled Coaching Institutes?
faqs.answer: Yes, under the Akanksha Scheme, the students of the selected families are provided with discounts on the fees charged by the M-Pendled coaching institutes. The discounts range from 25% to 100% depending upon the family's income.

faqs.question: Do Parents Of The Students Need To Meet Any Income Criteria To Receive Benefits Under The Akanksha Scheme In Madhya Pradesh?
faqs.answer: Yes, parents of the students must meet the specified income criteria that is 600000 to receive benefits under the Akanksha Scheme in Madhya Pradesh.

faqs.question: Are There Any Other Conditions That Students Must Meet To Receive Benefits Under The Akanksha Scheme In Madhya Pradesh?
faqs.answer: Yes, students must have a minimum of 70% attendance in the previous academic year to be eligible for the Akanksha Scheme in Madhya Pradesh.

faqs.question: How Can Students Apply For The Akanksha Scheme In Madhya Pradesh?
faqs.answer: Students can apply for the Akanksha Scheme in Madhya Pradesh online through the official website https://www.tribal.mp.gov.in/mptaas/ of the Madhya Pradesh government.

faqs.question: Are There Any Documents That Students Need To Submit Along With The Application?
faqs.answer: Yes, students need to submit the following documents along with the application: identity proof, residential proof, school leaving certificate, and caste certificate.
